snippet: The United Nations nuclear agency’s report raises the issue of whether an accord would compel Iran to detail past work on designing weapons.
abstract: International Atomic Energy Agency releases report charging that Iran continues to stonewall questions about evidence of past work on designing nuclear weapons; report comes as American and Iranian negotiators are set to meet for four days of talks in Geneva over country's nuclear program.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and William J. Broad from New York. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations nuclear agency’s report raises the issue of whether an accord would compel Iran to detail past work on designing weapons.

headline.main: Inspectors Say Iran Is Evading Questions as Nuclear Talks Enter a Crucial Stage
headline.print_headline: Inspectors Say Iran Is Evading Questions as Nuclear Talks Enter a Crucial Stage
